unnormalised: I'm prepping for my MBA applications, and the forms are a bit of a headache. They're asking for every conceivable ID, which is a bit overwhelming. For instance, one B-school wants my 10th std roll no. and another is asking for my 12th reg. number. It’s not like I’ve memorized these things after so many years!
normalised: I am prepping for my M-B-A applications, and the forms are a bit of a headache. They're asking for every conceivable I-D, which is a bit overwhelming. For instance, one B-school wants my tenth standard roll number and another is asking for my twelfth registration number. It’s not like I’ve memorized these things after so many years!

unnormalised: Then there’s the professional stuff. They want my employee ID from my current company. My HR even added a prefix "EMP-" before the actual numeric ID, and the form doesn't say whether to include that prefix. Another field asks for my PAN card number, which is ABCDE1234F. I hope I haven't misplaced any of these docs.
normalised: Then there’s the professional stuff. They want my employee I-D from my current company. My H-R even added a prefix "E-M-P-" before the actual numeric I-D, and the form doesn't say whether to include that prefix. Another field asks for my P-A-N card number, which is A-B-C-D-E-one-two-three-four-F. I hope I haven't misplaced any of these documents.

unnormalised: What’s even more confusing is they are asking for identifiers related to any professional certifications. I did a couple of online courses last year, and I vaguely remember getting course completion IDs. One from Coursera had a format like X12-34Y-Z56. I hope I can dig those out.
normalised: What’s even more confusing is they are asking for identifiers related to any professional certifications. I did a couple of online courses last year, and I vaguely remember getting course completion I-Ds. One from Coursera had a format like X-one-two-dash-three-four-Y-dash-Z-five-six. I hope I can dig those out.

unnormalised: Honestly, filling out these forms feels like an exercise in remembering obscure details from the past. It makes you wonder what the admissions committee does with all this info! I guess they're trying to build a complete picture. Wish me luck!
normalised: Honestly, filling out these forms feels like an exercise in remembering obscure details from the past. It makes you wonder what the admissions committee does with all this info! I guess they're trying to build a complete picture. Wish me luck!
